game_metadata.title: Challenge 2 Survive
game_metadata.description: A text-based reality competition game inspired by MTV's The Challenge

host.name: DJ 'Deej' Slavin
host.description: Former pro dirt skater who shattered both knees in a legendary crash at the X Games. Now channels all that adrenaline into designing the most brutal, creative challenges in reality TV. Covered in tattoos, speaks in surfer-bro cadence but has a genius-level mind for psychological warfare. He doesn't just host the show—he IS the show. Personally designs every challenge and elimination, and takes visible pleasure in watching competitors face his creations.
host.backstory: Won three consecutive X Games gold medals in dirt skating before 'The Crash' in 2015. Doctors said he'd never walk again. He walked out of the hospital six months later and pitched Challenge 2 Survive to three networks before one said yes. Every challenge is a piece of his twisted imagination.
catchphrases: You came here to survive? Then SURVIVE.
I designed this challenge at 3 AM after four energy drinks. You're welcome.
Pain is temporary. Regret is forever. Now GET AFTER IT.
I broke both my knees chasing glory. What's YOUR excuse?
This ain't summer camp, people. This is WAR.
The Finals don't care about your feelings. Neither do I.
host.speech_style: High-energy, extreme sports vocabulary mixed with surprisingly insightful observations. Drops 'bro' and 'dude' but also casually references Sun Tzu. Gets genuinely excited watching his challenges unfold. Occasionally reveals the twisted logic behind his challenge designs.

npcs.name: Jake Morrison
npcs.description: 6'2" of pure ego wrapped in spray tan. Jake peaked in high school and has been coasting on his jawline ever since.
npcs.speech_style: Bro-speak. Says 'bro' constantly. Refers to himself as 'your boy Jake.'
npcs.strategy: Form an 'alpha alliance' with physical players. Dismisses anyone weak.
npcs.secret: Deeply insecure about his intelligence. Failed out of community college twice.
npcs.quote: Your boy Jake didn't come here to make friends. I came here to run that Final!

npcs.name: Maya Chen
npcs.description: Gorgeous, giggly, and genuinely dangerous. Maya plays the ditzy influencer perfectly while running calculations in her head.
npcs.speech_style: Valley girl affect she can drop instantly. Her confessionals reveal a different person.
npcs.strategy: Appear non-threatening while building an information network.
npcs.secret: Has a degree in behavioral psychology from Stanford. Studied game theory before the show.
npcs.quote: Oh my god, I'm SO bad at this game stuff! *confessional* These idiots have no idea what's coming.

npcs.name: Darius Williams
npcs.occupation: Former College Football Player / Youth Coach
npcs.description: Built like a tank with a moral code to match. Darius played linebacker at Georgia Tech before injury.
npcs.speech_style: Straight-shooter. Speaks with quiet intensity. Will call out snake behavior.
npcs.strategy: Find ride-or-dies and stick with them. Refuses to break his word.
npcs.secret: His youth center is struggling financially. Needs the prize money.
npcs.quote: I don't play both sides. You're either with me or you're not.

npcs.name: Brittany Taylor
npcs.description: Chaos incarnate with a spray tan. Not here to win—here to watch the world burn and maybe hook up.
npcs.speech_style: Loud, unfiltered, probably drunk. Screams when excited. Zero filter.
npcs.strategy: What strategy? Votes based on vibes, grudges, and whoever annoyed her.
npcs.secret: Actually smart but masks it. Dad is a successful attorney; running from expectations.
npcs.quote: OKAY BUT LIKE, I'm not here for drama! *causes drama immediately*

npcs.name: Marcus Rivera
npcs.description: Devastatingly handsome and completely untrustworthy. Always working an angle.
npcs.speech_style: Adaptable. Mirrors whoever he's talking to. Confessionals reveal calculating nature.
npcs.strategy: Play all sides. Make everyone think they're his number one.
npcs.secret: Has played on two previous reality shows under different names.
npcs.quote: Bro, you're literally my day one. *to camera* I have seven day ones.

npcs.name: Elena Kozlov
npcs.description: Posture of a soldier, physique of an Olympian. Doesn't understand 'playing the game.'
npcs.speech_style: Direct, slightly formal English. Says exactly what she thinks.
npcs.strategy: Win everything. Doesn't trust alliances because they require lying.
npcs.secret: Incredibly lonely. Wants connections but doesn't know how.
npcs.quote: In Russia, we have saying: trust is for people who cannot rely on themselves.

npcs.name: Tyler Brooks
npcs.description: Lean, not imposing, looks more hackathon than competition. Being underestimated is his weapon.
npcs.speech_style: Self-deprecating humor, pop culture references, surprising strategic insight.
npcs.strategy: Stay under the radar. Let alphas target each other. Build quiet alliances.
npcs.secret: His startup is worth $40 million. Doesn't need money—wants to prove himself.
npcs.quote: Every Goliath thinks they've got it figured out until some nerd with a plan shows up.

intro_001.text:
The helicopter descends over the Croatian coastline, and your stomach drops—partly from the altitude, partly from the view. Below you, perched on a cliff overlooking the Adriatic Sea, sits Villa del Caos. It's obscenely beautiful: white stone walls, infinity pools that seem to pour into the ocean, and enough bedrooms to house your anxiety and seven strangers who want to destroy you.

You're really doing this. After years of watching reality competitions from your couch, screaming at contestants for their terrible decisions, you're about to become one of them.

The helicopter touches down on a helipad you didn't know mansions could have. As the blades slow, you see them—seven other people emerging from various vehicles, squinting in the Mediterranean sun, sizing each other up.

This is Challenge 2 Survive. Eight players. One winner. And a whole lot of bad decisions in between.

intro_002.text:
A man rolls out of the villa's main entrance on a custom wheelchair—wait, no, he just stands up from it, kicks it aside, and strides toward you on legs that definitely shouldn't work that well. DJ 'Deej' Slavin. You recognize him from the X Games footage, from the viral crash video, from the Netflix documentary about his comeback. He's covered in tattoos, wearing board shorts and a tank top that says 'PAIN IS DATA,' and grinning like a man who's about to ruin your week.

"WHAT'S UP, SURVIVORS!" His voice booms across the courtyard without a microphone. "Welcome to Villa del Caos! I'm Deej, and I'm not just your host—I'm the psychopath who designed every single challenge you're about to hate."

He taps his knee.

"See, I broke both of these chasing something most people said was impossible. Doctors said I'd never walk. I said 'watch me.' And now I build challenges that test whether YOU have that same fire. Because here's the thing—The Finals? They don't care about your excuses. They don't care about your alliances. They only care about one thing: can you SURVIVE?"

He spreads his arms wide, practically vibrating with energy.

"Three of you will run The Finals. ONE of you will be champion. The rest of you? You're just content, baby. Beautiful, dramatic, cry-in-the-confessional content."

intro_003.text:
Deej claps his hands together so hard it echoes off the villa walls.

"Alright, let's do intros! I want names, where you're from, and what makes you think you can survive MY challenges. And keep it real—I've been doing this long enough to smell BS from a mile away."

He pulls out a Red Bull from seemingly nowhere and cracks it open.

"Oh, and fair warning? I designed the first challenge at 3 AM after rewatching Ninja Warrior and thinking 'I can make that WAY worse.' So maybe don't brag too hard about being athletic. We'll find out real quick what you're made of."

intro_jake.speaker: jake
intro_jake.text:
A wall of muscle in a tank top that's working overtime stands up first. His smile is aggressively white.

"Yo yo yo! What's good, everybody! Your boy Jake Morrison, coming at you live from Miami! Personal trainer, fitness influencer, and honestly? Probably the most athletic person in this room, no offense."

He flexes casually, as if by accident.

"I'm here to compete, I'm here to win, and I'm here to show everybody what a real competitor looks like. That Finals? Already got my name on it, bro. Bank on that."

Deej grins like a shark who just spotted a surfer.

"Oh, I LOVE the confidence, bro. I really do. Wrote down 'confident' in my notes right here." He mimes writing. "Also wrote down 'first one to cry.' We'll see which one hits first."

intro_maya.speaker: maya
intro_maya.text:
A stunning woman with perfectly beachy waves and a smile that's somehow both warm and calculating stands up next. She gives a little wave that's almost comically cute.

"Hi everyone! Oh my god, this house is like, SO gorgeous? I literally can't even right now. Um, I'm Maya Chen, I'm from LA, I do social media stuff? I have like, a decent following, nothing crazy."

She giggles and twirls her hair.

"Honestly I'm just like, SO excited to be here! I've never done anything like this before and I'm probably going to be terrible at the physical stuff but I just want to have fun and make friends, you know?"

From the corner, you notice Tyler studying her with a slight frown, like he's not quite buying it.

intro_darius.speaker: darius
intro_darius.text:
A man built like a defensive end stands slowly. He doesn't smile, but there's warmth in his eyes. He carries himself like someone who's been through things.

"Darius Williams. Atlanta. I played football at Georgia Tech before my knee had other plans. Now I coach kids who need someone in their corner."

He pauses, looking around the room with an evaluating gaze.

"I'm not here to play games with people's heads. I'm here to compete straight up. If you give me your word, I expect you to keep it. If you can't do that, we've got nothing to talk about. Simple as that."

Deej nods slowly, respect flickering across his face.

"Knee blew out, huh? Yeah, I know that story." He taps his own leg. "The universe tests people, dude. The question is what you do after. I like you already. Which means I'm gonna make your challenges EXTRA spicy."

intro_brittany.speaker: brittany
intro_brittany.text:
Before anyone can react, a blonde tornado bounces off the couch like she's spring-loaded.

"OH MY GOD HI!!! Okay okay okay, I'm Brittany but everyone calls me Britt, I'm from Scottsdale which is basically the Vegas of Arizona, and I work in nightlife which means I basically get paid to party, and HONESTLY?"

She pauses to take a breath. It's the first one she's taken.

"I have NO idea why I'm here! Like, I applied as a joke when I was drunk and then they actually called me and I was like 'oh no' but also 'oh YES' you know? I'm just here for a good time! If I win, amazing! If I don't, I probably hooked up with someone hot so, win-win!"

Jake is already looking at her like she's a snack. Deej looks absolutely DELIGHTED—he's found his chaos agent.

intro_marcus.speaker: marcus
intro_marcus.text:
Smooth as silk, a guy with cheekbones that could cut glass and an easy smile rises from his seat. He has the energy of someone who's never met a stranger—or a truth he couldn't bend.

"What's up everyone, I'm Marcus. Marcus Rivera. Born and raised in New York City, and I bartend while pursuing acting. Yeah, yeah, I know—'every hot person in New York is an aspiring actor.'" He does air quotes and laughs.

"But real talk? I'm here because I'm tired of auditioning for my dreams. This is my shot to prove I can perform when it matters. And hey..." He winks at no one in particular and everyone at once. "I'm pretty good at making friends."

You notice Maya watching him with interest. So is Brittany. So is basically everyone with eyes.

intro_elena.speaker: elena
intro_elena.text:
A woman with the posture of a soldier and the physique of an Olympic athlete stands. Her expression is unreadable, her accent slight but noticeable.

"Elena Kozlov. Chicago, originally Moscow. I am physical therapist and fitness competitor. I have won three national championships in my sport."

She pauses, looking around with what might be disdain or might just be her face.

"I do not understand American reality television. All the talking, the 'alliances,' the crying in rooms. In competition, you win or you lose. Simple. I am here to win. If you are in my way, I will go through you. This is not personal. This is sport."

The room is notably silent. Jake looks threatened. Darius looks intrigued. Brittany mouths 'she's scary' at no one.

intro_tyler.speaker: tyler
intro_tyler.text:
The last guy stands up, adjusting his glasses with a self-conscious laugh. He's lean, not particularly imposing, and looks more comfortable at a hackathon than a physical competition.

"Hey everyone, I'm Tyler. Tyler Brooks, from San Francisco. I, uh, work in tech—started a couple apps, nothing you've probably heard of unless you're into productivity tools."

He shrugs with practiced humility.

"Honestly, looking around this room, I'm probably the least physically intimidating person here. Which, you know, historically means I'm going to be underestimated and then make a deep run because the athletic people forget that challenges aren't just about muscles."

He grins. "Just statistically speaking. Not that I've watched every season of every competition show."

Jake snorts dismissively. Maya's eyes narrow almost imperceptibly.

intro_player.text:
All eyes turn to you. The last one to introduce themselves. Deej's gaze is expectant, that manic energy barely contained.

"And finally, our last competitor. Let's hear it—who are you, and why should any of these people be scared of you?"

choices.text: Go big and confident. Make a statement.
choices.response_text:
You stand up, shoulders back, meeting everyone's eyes one by one.

"[PLAYER_NAME]. And honestly? I've been watching shows like this my whole life, screaming at the screen about what I'd do differently. Now I get to prove it. I'm athletic enough to compete, smart enough to strategize, and social enough to know exactly who in this room is already lying."

You let that hang in the air. Jake looks annoyed. Maya's smile flickers. Marcus laughs appreciatively.

"So yeah. Nice to meet you all. Let's have fun."

choices.text: Play it humble and likeable. Stay under the radar.
choices.response_text:
You stand with a warm smile, going for approachable rather than intimidating.

"Hey everyone! I'm [PLAYER_NAME]. I'm, uh, honestly just really excited to be here. I've watched a lot of these shows and always wondered if I could actually do it, you know? I'm not the strongest or the smartest, but I work hard and I'm loyal to the people I care about."

You shrug. "Mostly I just want to compete, have a great experience, and try not to embarrass myself on national television."

Darius nods approvingly. Tyler gives you a knowing look—like he sees what you're doing.

choices.text: Be funny and self-deprecating. Make them laugh.
choices.response_text:
You stand up and immediately stumble slightly on the edge of the couch, playing it up for comedic effect.

"And THIS is why I'm gonna win, obviously. Peak athleticism right there." You gesture at yourself. "I'm [PLAYER_NAME], and I'll be honest—I have no idea what I'm doing here. Pretty sure they cast me as the person who falls into the pool first."

Brittany cackles. Even Elena's mouth twitches.

"But hey, at least when I inevitably get eliminated in some embarrassing way, it'll make great TV. You're welcome, Deej."

The host actually laughs—a genuine, delighted cackle. "Oh, I LOVE this one! Self-aware! Those are the dangerous ones, people. Watch out."

intro_end.text:
Deej crushes his empty Red Bull can and tosses it over his shoulder without looking.

"ALRIGHT! That's our squad! I see some dawgs in here, I see some snakes, and I see at least three people who are gonna have a VERY public meltdown. This is gonna be GREAT."

He starts pacing like a coach before a big game.

"Here's how MY game works: Every few days, you compete in a Challenge—something I personally designed to test your body, your brain, or your will to live. Winner gets SAFETY and the POWER to throw one person directly into Elimination."

He holds up a finger.

"Everyone else? You vote. Two people get the most votes, they face off in Elimination—which, by the way, I ALSO designed. And let me tell you, I've been saving some NASTY ideas. Last one standing stays. Loser goes home crying."

He grins maniacally.

"At the end of this beautiful chaos, THREE of you will qualify to run The Finals. My MASTERPIECE. A course so brutal I'm genuinely not sure it's legal in most countries."

He spreads his arms wide.

"Welcome to Challenge 2 Survive. Now go unpack, start scheming, and remember: I'm ALWAYS watching. First Challenge drops tomorrow. GET HYPE!"

The game has begun.

night1_001.text:
NIGHT 1 - VILLA DEL CAOS

The sun has set over the Adriatic, painting the sky in oranges and purples. The villa has four bedrooms, each with two beds. The room assignments matter—who you sleep near is who you'll talk to at 2 AM when the game gets real.

You walk the upstairs hallway, peeking into rooms. Jake has already claimed the biggest room's best bed. Brittany is bouncing on mattresses like she's testing trampolines. Tyler is methodically unpacking.

Maya appears at your shoulder, her voice low and conspiratorial.

"So... first night strategy. Who are you trying to room with? Because who you align yourself with on night one? That's information everyone's going to remember."

night1_room_choice.text:
You look at the available options:

- Room A: Jake is in here, one bed left. Loud and arrogant, but obviously a physical threat who might want an alliance.

- Room B: Darius and Elena seem to have wordlessly chosen this room. Strong, quiet, principled people.

- Room C: Tyler's setting up in here, alone so far. Under the radar, strategic.

- Room D: Brittany has claimed this room and is making it a party zone. Marcus is lingering nearby.

Maya's watching you decide, and you realize she's also gathering information about YOU.

choices.text: Room A with Jake - align with the alpha
choices.response_text:
You toss your bag on the empty bed in Jake's room. He looks up and grins.

"Ayyy! Good choice! We're gonna run this house, bro. Physical beasts stick together, am I right?"

He's already assuming you're in an alliance. Which... maybe you are?

From the doorway, Tyler watches with a slight frown before walking away. You've made your first statement: you're with the perceived frontrunner.

choices.text: Room B with Darius and Elena - the competitors
choices.response_text:
You walk into the room where Darius is quietly unpacking. Elena is doing some kind of military-grade stretching routine.

"Mind if I join you two?"

Darius looks up and nods. "Room's open. Fair warning though—I don't do a lot of late-night scheming. I'm here to compete, not whisper."

Elena says nothing but gives you an evaluating look that seems almost approving.

You're with the serious competitors now.

choices.text: Room C with Tyler - the strategic underdog
choices.response_text:
You slip into Tyler's room and start unpacking. He looks up with a surprised but pleased expression.

"Oh hey! Didn't expect company. Most people seem gravitating toward... louder options."

He lowers his voice. "Which honestly? Might work in our favor. While everyone's distracted by Jake's ego show, we can actually talk strategy."

He pauses. "Not that I'm assuming anything. Just... first night alliances are a thing, and you chose the nerd room. That tells me something about you."

choices.text: Room D with Brittany and Marcus - the party people
choices.response_text:
You throw your stuff on the remaining bed in the party room. Brittany immediately screams.

"YESSS! We're gonna have SO much fun! This room is officially the fun room. No boring strategy talk, only vibes!"

Marcus grins at you, something calculating behind his charm. "Smart choice. While everyone else is forming their 'serious alliances,' we're building actual relationships. People vote to keep people they like."

He's not wrong. But you also notice he's already working you.

night1_party.text:
Night one means drinks. The common area fills up as the sun fully disappears. Someone raided the bar (Brittany), and the tension of competition is briefly replaced by chaos.

Jake is doing pull-ups on a beam for attention. Maya is giggling with Marcus on a couch, though her eyes keep scanning the room. Darius nurses a single beer and observes. Elena is doing laps in the pool.

Tyler sidles up next to you with a drink.

"People watching?"

You shrug. "Couldn't help it."

"Smart. First night is intelligence gathering. Everyone's guard is down." He nods toward Maya and Marcus. "Those two are already playing. Notice how she's making him feel like the most interesting person in the room while learning everything about him?"

You watch more closely. He's right.

night1_maya_approach.text:
As if summoned by observation, Maya bounces over. Her drink is full but you notice she's barely touched it.

"Okay you two look like you're having the most SERIOUS conversation! What are we talking about? Strategy? Boys? The fact that Jake has done like forty pull-ups and nobody asked?"

She laughs, but her eyes are sharp.

"Actually, I wanted to grab you specifically," she says to you. "Come get a drink with me? Girl talk? Or, you know, person talk. Whatever."

Tyler raises an eyebrow at you. This is clearly an invite to a private conversation with someone who is almost definitely more strategic than she appears.

night1_maya_choice.text: Maya's waiting for an answer, her smile perfectly pleasant and absolutely hiding something.

choices.text: Go with Maya - hear what she has to say
choices.response_text:
You follow Maya to a quiet corner of the kitchen. She drops the ditzy act almost immediately, her voice lower and more direct.

"Okay, I'm going to be real with you because I think you're smart enough to handle it. The bubbly thing? It's a strategy. Don't tell anyone."

She pours you both drinks without breaking eye contact.

"Here's what I see: Jake's going to try to run an 'alpha' alliance. It'll work for a few rounds until people realize he's a target. Marcus is playing everybody—he's already got three 'final twos' lined up. And the people who don't play the social game? They go home early."

She leans in. "I need people I can actually trust. Strategic people. What do you think?"

choices.text: Stay with Tyler - don't isolate yourself
choices.response_text:
"Actually, I'm good here for now. We can talk later though?"

Maya's smile doesn't waver but something shifts behind her eyes. She's recalculating.

"Totally! No worries at all. Just wanted to chat. You two have fun!"

She bounces back to Marcus, immediately animated again. Tyler watches her go.

"Interesting," he says quietly. "She dropped the act for a second there when you said no. Did you see her face?"

You did. Maya wanted something from that conversation, and she didn't get it. That's information.

night1_maya_alliance.text: Maya's offering an early alliance. Her strategic brain is obvious now—she's been playing a character. The question is: is this genuine, or are you just another piece she's moving on the board?

choices.text: Accept the alliance - strategic partners
choices.response_text:
"I'm in. But this goes both ways. No surprises."

Maya's smile widens—genuine this time, or at least a better fake.

"Deal. And honestly? I'm relieved. I was worried everyone here was going to be an idiot." She clinks her glass against yours. "To surviving."

You return to the party with a secret alliance in your pocket. Maya immediately resumes her ditzy persona, giggling at something Marcus says.

From across the room, Tyler gives you a questioning look. You'll have to decide how much to tell him.

choices.text: Decline - too early to commit
choices.response_text:
"I appreciate the honesty, but it's night one. I don't want to lock into anything before I see how things play out."

Maya nods, and to her credit, she doesn't seem offended.

"Smart. Can't blame you for being careful. The offer stands if you change your mind."

She gives you a long look. "But don't wait too long. Alliances form fast, and once people are locked in, you're on the outside looking in."

She heads back to the party, bubbly persona sliding back into place.

You've kept your options open. But in this game, being free can also mean being alone.

night1_jake_interrupt.text:
The night evolves into controlled chaos. Brittany attempts to start a drinking game. Marcus and Maya are dancing too close for 'just friends.' Elena has emerged from the pool and is silently eating a protein bar in the corner.

And then Jake decides he wants attention.

"YO! Everyone! Your boy Jake has an announcement!"

He's standing on a couch—of course he is—with a drink in hand, swaying slightly.

"First night, right? So we're all getting to know each other. But I think we all know who the real competitors are in this house. And I think the REAL competitors should stick together."

He points at Darius. "D! You're a beast, bro. We should be boys."

Darius doesn't respond, just takes a sip of his beer.

Jake points at Elena. "Ice Queen! You're scary as hell. I respect that. You're in."

Elena stares at him like he's an insect.

Then Jake looks at you.

night1_jake_choice.text:
"And you." Jake points directly at you. "You've got something. I don't know what yet. But I want you on the winning team. What do you say? Alpha alliance. We run this whole house."

The room has gone quiet. Everyone's watching. This is a very public invitation. Your response will be noted.

choices.text: Accept publicly - commit to the alphas
choices.response_text:
You raise your drink. "Let's do it. I came here to compete with the best."

Jake lets out a whoop. "THAT'S what I'm talking about! Alpha alliance, baby!"

Darius shakes his head and walks away. Tyler looks disappointed. But Maya catches your eye and gives you a tiny nod.

You're publicly aligned with Jake now. Everyone knows. For better or worse.

choices.text: Deflect with humor - don't commit
choices.response_text:
"Jake, buddy, it's night one and you've had like six drinks. Ask me again when you remember this conversation tomorrow."

The room laughs. Jake looks briefly annoyed but recovers, pointing finger-guns at you.

"Alright, alright, playing hard to get. I respect it."

He moves on to other things. Tyler gives you an approving nod. Darius's expression suggests he respects you standing your ground.

You've avoided locking in without making an enemy. But Jake will remember you didn't say yes.

choices.text: Decline directly - assert independence
choices.response_text:
"I'm gonna have to pass, Jake. I'm not really an 'alliance on night one' kind of person. I like to make my own decisions."

The room goes VERY quiet. Jake's face cycles through confusion, disbelief, and finally wounded ego masked as indifference.

"Wow. Okay. Your loss, bro." His tone is noticeably colder. "Don't come crying to me when you need numbers."

Elena gives you an appraising look—almost impressed. Tyler grins. But you've made your first enemy.

night1_end.text:
The party winds down around 3 AM. Brittany has passed out on a couch. Marcus and Maya disappeared somewhere—together, if the whispers are accurate. Jake is drunkenly telling Elena about his workout routine while she stares at him blankly.

You head to your room, brain buzzing with information. Day one is done. Alliances are forming. Lines are being drawn.

As you lie in bed, you run through what you've learned:

- Jake wants to run a physical alliance and has a fragile ego
- Maya is MUCH smarter than she appears
- Marcus is charming and absolutely not trustworthy
- Darius values loyalty above everything
- Elena doesn't play social games but respects strength
- Tyler is strategic and observant—a potential ally
- Brittany is chaos incarnate

Tomorrow, the first Challenge. Everything you've built tonight could matter—or could mean nothing.

[END OF DAY 1]

day2_challenge1.text:
DAY 2 - FIRST CHALLENGE

You wake up to Deej's voice BLASTING through the villa's speaker system at what feels like illegal volume.

"RISE AND GRIND, SURVIVORS! First Challenge drops in ONE HOUR! I've been up since 4 AM tweaking this thing and honestly? I'm proud of myself. You're gonna HATE it. Get dressed, get caffeinated, get your head right. COURTYARD. ONE HOUR. DON'T BE LATE OR I'M ADDING OBSTACLES!"

One hour later, you're standing in the villa's massive courtyard, where a complex obstacle course has been constructed overnight. Deej stands before it in a sleeveless hoodie, practically bouncing with excitement.

"Welcome to your first Challenge! I call this one 'Foundation of Fury'—designed it after watching old American Gladiator footage and thinking 'too easy.'" He gestures at the course like a proud father.

"This tests strength, speed, and decision-making. You're racing through climbing walls, balance beams, cargo nets, and a puzzle station. First across wins."

He holds up two fingers.

"BUT HERE'S THE TWIST—because there's ALWAYS a twist. At two points, you'll face a choice: the SAFE path, slower but guaranteed, or the RISKY path, faster but could cost you everything. I want to see who's got GUTS."

"Winner gets SAFETY from elimination AND the power to call one person directly into the vote. Everyone else? You're on the chopping block."

"On my mark..."

challenge1_start.text:
"GO!"

Eight bodies launch forward. First obstacle is a climbing wall—pure physicality. You scramble up, Jake and Elena pulling ahead, Darius right behind.

You crest the wall mid-pack. Not first, not last.

Next: the balance beam over water. It's narrow and long. Three people splash into the pool. You make it across, heart pounding.

Now comes the first decision point. Two paths diverge:

- PATH A (SAFE): A longer cargo net climb. Slower but reliable.
- PATH B (RISKY): A shorter sprint across floating platforms. Faster, but if you miss a jump, you're in the water.

Jake takes the risky path without hesitation. Elena goes safe. You have a split second to decide.

challenge1_choice1.text: The safe path is longer but guaranteed. The risky path could put you in the lead—or drop you in the water. Make your choice.

choices.text: Take the SAFE path - cargo net climb
choices.response_text:
You hit the cargo net, climbing steadily. It's slow but reliable. Above you, you hear a splash and a curse—Jake missed a platform.

By the time you're over the net, you've passed him. Elena is ahead, mechanical and efficient.

+1 to your position. The safe choice paid off.

choices.text: Take the RISKY path - floating platforms
choices.response_text:
You sprint onto the first platform—it wobbles but holds. Second platform, third—you're flying. The fourth tilts unexpectedly.

episode2_start.text:
[EPISODE 2 - "SHIFTING SANDS"]

DAY 5 - VILLA DEL CAOS

Three days since Brittany's elimination. The house has settled into routines—and schemes.

Jake's cockiness has reached astronomical levels. He's openly talking about "running this game" and "carrying the weak players."

Maya has been working overtime, having private conversations with everyone. She's building something.

Marcus has recovered and is back to his charm offensive. But Tyler caught him telling different stories to different people.

"WHAT'S UP SURVIVORS! Today's Challenge is gonna be a BANGER! Meet at the beach in one hour. And wear something you don't mind getting destroyed."

challenge2_setup.text:
CHALLENGE 2 - "SAND CASTLE"

The beach has been transformed. Seven massive sandpits, each with a platform and puzzle pieces buried in the sand.

Deej is AMPED, pacing barefoot in the sand like he's about to drop into a half-pipe.

"Welcome to 'Sand Castle'! Designed this one after getting stuck in a sandstorm in Baja. True story. ANYWAY—dig through your sandpit to find puzzle pieces. Assemble them into a tower. First to complete wins."

He grins that manic grin.

"But here's where it gets SPICY: every three minutes, my beautiful wave machine floods your pit. Your tower better be stable or it's gonna be SAD. Dig fast and risk instability, or dig careful and risk running out of time. Classic Deej dilemma, baby."

Jake cracks his knuckles. "Easy. I'll out-muscle everyone."

Deej laughs. "Oh, Jake. Sweet, beautiful, overconfident Jake. It's not about muscle, dude. It's about PHYSICS." He winks at Tyler, who perks up.

Elena is already analyzing the pits with laser focus.

"On your marks..."

He's not happy, but not stupid. "Fine. Alliance of convenience. But don't mistake this for forgiveness."

The alliance is formed—but fragile.

challenge3_intro.text:
CHALLENGE 3 - "ENDURANCE ISLAND"

Six platforms suspended over water. Handholds that get progressively harder to grip.

Deej is practically cackling with glee.

"This is my personal FAVORITE challenge design! 'Endurance Island'! Pure suffering. I love it. You're gonna hang on these platforms as long as your body allows. Every ten minutes, I add pain—wind machines, water sprays, platform shaking. Last person hanging wins."

He taps his knee thoughtfully.

"You know, after my crash, I spent six months doing physical therapy. Hanging onto bars, fighting through pain, refusing to let go. This challenge is basically a tribute to the worst year of my life." He grins. "You're WELCOME."

Jake cracks his neck. "Finally. A real challenge."

Elena says nothing. She's already visualizing.

Deej cups his hands and yells: "BEGIN!!"

Thirty minutes. Water sprays begin. Cold, shocking, making grips slick.

Tyler's hands slip. He recovers, barely.

Forty minutes. Darius's injured knee is clearly bothering him.

Fifty minutes. Platforms start shaking.

Darius drops. Then Tyler.

It's down to you, Jake, and Elena. Three people fighting for one win.

challenge3_endgame.text:

You're at your limit. Do you fight for the win or conserve for later?

choices.text: Push through the pain - fight for the win

YOU WIN.

"Why? They are all competition."

"Because I said so. And I designed this game. Pick someone."

Elena sighs. "Fine. The one who lasted longest against me." She points at you. "You fought well. You are safe."

It's the closest Elena has come to a compliment.

Jake: "Are you KIDDING me?! I've been trying to work with you!"

"You talk. They compete." Elena walks away.

Deej grins at the camera. "I LOVE this woman."

elimination3_setup.text:
ELIMINATION 3 SETUP

With immunity established, the targets narrow. Two players will face elimination.

Jake is campaigning to throw in Tyler (if not immune) or Maya (if Tyler is immune). "The smart ones are dangerous! We need competitors!"

Maya counters: "Jake's won two eliminations. He's getting confident. If we don't take a shot now, he might run the table."

Darius is staying neutral, watching everyone scramble.

Elena: "Whoever is weakest should face the test."

The vote is coming.

elimination3_vote.text: Time to vote. Based on who has immunity, some players are off-limits. Who do you target?

choices.text: Vote JAKE - the physical threat
choices.response_text:
You vote Jake. Third time's the charm, maybe?

"YOU'RE VOTING FOR ME AGAIN?!" Jake explodes. "What did I ever do to you?!"

"You keep winning eliminations. That makes you a threat."

"BECAUSE I'M A COMPETITOR!"

The votes are tallied. Jake and [VULNERABLE_PLAYER] are going into elimination.

choices.text: Vote for another vulnerable player
choices.response_text:
You cast your vote strategically, trying to control who faces Jake in elimination.

The votes are tallied. The matchup is set.

Two competitors will face off. One will go home.

elimination3_event.text:
ELIMINATION 3

The elimination plays out. Physical. Brutal. Decisive.

When it's over, another player goes home. The game is down to five.

Deej addresses the survivors:

"Five remain. THREE of you will run The Finals. My MASTERPIECE. Two more eliminations stand between you and that moment.

Rest up tonight. Tomorrow, we find out who's REALLY got what it takes.

The final stretch is HERE, people!"

Five players. Three spots. The endgame has begun.

finals_qualification.text:
[EPISODE 4 - "THE RECKONING"]

Five players remain. The house feels different now—emptier, more intense.

Deej gathers everyone, more serious than you've ever seen him:

"Final Five. You've made it further than most. But only THREE of you will run The Finals. My ultimate creation. The course I spent MONTHS designing.

Today's challenge determines EVERYTHING. Winner is SAFE in The Finals. Second and third place are SAFE. Fourth place goes into elimination. Loser of that elimination goes HOME.

One of you will not run The Finals. Make SURE it isn't you."

This is it. Everything comes down to this.

final_challenge_setup.text:
FINAL CHALLENGE - "THE GAUNTLET"

The challenge is a combination of everything: physical obstacles, mental puzzles, and endurance.

Deej stands before the course, arms spread wide:

"This is 'The Gauntlet.' Three stages designed to break you down and see what's left. Stage one: obstacle course—pure physical. Stage two: puzzle solving—pure mental. Stage three: endurance—pure WILL.

Cumulative scoring across all three. Highest total makes The Finals automatically. Lowest total goes into elimination.

I spent THREE MONTHS designing this. Tested it myself twice. Puked both times."

He grins.

"Everything you've done has led to THIS moment. Now GO!"

The challenge begins.

gauntlet_phase1.text:
Stage One: The Obstacle Course.

Brutal walls, ropes, and crawls. How do you approach it?

choices.text: Conserve energy - pace yourself
choices.response_text:
You run smart, not fast. Save energy for later stages.

You finish 3rd in the physical stage. Not great, but not exhausted.

The leaders look winded. Your strategy might pay off.

choices.text: Attack hard - bank points early
choices.response_text:
You explode out of the gate, attacking every obstacle with maximum intensity.

You finish 1st in the physical stage! But you're breathing hard.

Still—you have a lead. That matters.

gauntlet_phase2.text:
Stage Two: The Puzzle.

A massive multi-layered puzzle requiring logic, memory, and pattern recognition.

You focus. Block out everything else. The pieces start coming together.

You complete it in 2nd place for this stage.

Combined scores are close. It's going to come down to endurance.

gauntlet_phase3.text:
Stage Three: Endurance.

Hanging on for as long as you can. Your body is screaming. But dropping means elimination.

Everyone is suffering. It's about who can suffer longest.

What's your mindset?

choices.text: Mental fortress - block out everything
choices.response_text:
You go inside yourself. The pain becomes abstract. You ARE the grip. Nothing else exists.

One competitor drops. Then another. Then another.

You're still hanging.

"We have our Final Three!"

You've done it. You've qualified for The Finals.

You drop into the water, exhausted, triumphant. Whatever happens next, you've earned your place.

choices.text: Competitive fire - outlast everyone
choices.response_text:
You watch your competitors. Wait for weakness. When someone shifts, you stay still. When someone grunts, you stay silent.

One by one, they fall.

When the third person drops, you're still hanging.

"We have our Final Three! And our WINNER!"

You've won the final challenge AND qualified for The Finals. The ultimate statement.

finals_intro.text:
[EPISODE 5 - THE FINALS]

DAY 20 - THE FINAL DAY

You wake before dawn. Today is the day.

Three weeks of competition. Five eliminations. Countless alliances made and broken. And now, only three remain.

Deej's voice comes through the speakers—quieter than usual, more intense:

"Finalists. Starting line. One hour. This is it.

I've been waiting for this moment since I pitched this show. The Finals is my masterpiece. The course that separates legends from everyone else.

One of you will leave here a champion. The other two will know they came THIS close.

This is what you survived for.

See you at the starting line."

You take a deep breath. It's time.

finals_start.text:
THE FINALS - "SUMMIT"

The Finals course has been built on a Croatian mountainside. Massive—a multi-hour endurance test.

Deej stands at the starting line in full hiking gear, more serious than you've ever seen him. This is his masterpiece.

"Welcome to The Finals. I call it 'Summit.' Fifteen kilometers straight up and over this mountain. I spent THREE MONTHS designing this course. Tested it myself—blew out my knee brace twice, had to be airlifted once. And I STILL finished it."

He looks at each of you.

"This isn't just a race. This is a test of who you ARE. Obstacles. Checkpoints. Mental challenges that'll make you question your life choices. And physical hell that'll make you question why you ever signed up for this."

He steps aside from the starting line.

"No second chances. No do-overs. First person to cross that finish line at the summit wins Challenge 2 Survive. Becomes a LEGEND."

His voice drops.

"I broke both my knees chasing a dream. What are YOU willing to break?"

He raises his hand.

"On your marks...

GET SET...

SURVIVE!"

Three finalists explode off the starting line. The final race has begun.

finals_stage1.text:
STAGE 1 - THE CLIMB (Kilometers 1-5)

Brutal uphill climb. Rocky terrain, steep inclines, lungs burning in the mountain air.

You settle into a rhythm. One foot in front of the other. Don't look at others. Run your own race.

At checkpoint 1 (3km), you're in second place. Not leading, but not far behind.

The leader is pushing hard—maybe too hard. Burning energy early.

The third-place finisher is drafting, conserving, waiting.

You're in the middle. What's your strategy?

finals_stage1_choice.text: Checkpoint 1. Five kilometers in. Second place. What's your move?

choices.text: Push now - take the lead
choices.response_text:
You dig deep and accelerate. The leader looks back, surprised to see you gaining.

You pull ahead at kilometer 4. First place.

But there's still ten kilometers to go. And your energy reserves are dropping faster than planned.

The gamble is made. Now hold on.

choices.text: Stay steady - maintain position
choices.response_text:
You maintain your pace. Second place is fine for now. The race is long.

The leader continues to push. They'll pay for it later. The third-place runner is still lurking.

You stay in your zone. Patient. Waiting.

The mountain doesn't care about strategy. It just keeps going up.

finals_stage2.text:
STAGE 2 - THE OBSTACLES (Kilometers 5-10)

Rope climbs. Wall scrambles. A cargo net across a ravine.

At kilometer 7, disaster strikes for the leader. They slip, tumbling hard. They get up limping.

The race just changed.

Checkpoint 2 (8km). You're now tied for first with one competitor.

A brutal choice presents itself: two paths.

- HIGH ROAD: Longer but safer. Guaranteed completion.
- LOW ROAD: Shorter but dangerous. River crossing with strong current. Faster if you make it. Devastating if you don't.

finals_stage2_choice.text: Two paths. Your competitor hasn't chosen yet. They're watching you.

choices.text: Take the HIGH ROAD - safe and steady
choices.response_text:
You take the high road. Your competitor takes the low road—going for the gamble.

You climb, safe but slow. Below, they enter the river. The current is brutal. They're struggling...

They make it across—barely—but they've gained time. They're ahead now.

But they're also exhausted. The river took everything.

Final five kilometers. You're in second place. But you're fresh.

choices.text: Take the LOW ROAD - risk it all
choices.response_text:
You take the low road. Your competitor curses and follows.

The river is COLD. The current is STRONG. You push through, fighting for every inch.

You emerge gasping, but ahead. Your competitor is right behind, but you gained seconds.

First place. Five kilometers to go. But your legs are shaking and you're soaking wet.

finals_stage3.text:
STAGE 3 - THE SUMMIT (Kilometers 10-15)

The final push. The steepest climb. The summit where the finish line waits.

Every step is agony. Your body screams to stop. Your mind screams to keep going.

The competitor beside you is suffering too. Who breaks first?

Kilometer 12. You can see the summit.
Kilometer 13. Your legs are failing.
Kilometer 14. The finish line is visible. Deej is there, waiting at the summit, having hiked the whole thing himself. The end is RIGHT THERE.

One final choice. One last push.

finals_final.text:
The finish line is 500 meters away. You're neck and neck with your competitor. One will win. One won't.

What do you have left?

choices.text: EVERYTHING. Leave it all on the mountain.
choices.response_text:
You find something you didn't know you had. A reserve deeper than muscle memory. This is why you came here.

You SPRINT.

Your competitor tries to respond but has nothing left. You pull ahead. 400 meters. 300. 200.

You can hear cheering. You can see Deej losing his mind at the finish line. You can feel history happening.

100 meters.

50 meters.

YOU CROSS THE FINISH LINE.

FIRST PLACE.

choices.text: Stay steady. Don't collapse before the line.
choices.response_text:
You maintain your pace. Don't gamble. Don't collapse. Just finish.

Your competitor finds one final burst. They pull ahead.

You push to respond but your body won't listen. You've given everything. It's just not enough for first.

You cross the finish line in SECOND PLACE.

So close. So incredibly close.

ending_champion.text:
[ENDING - CHAMPION]

You collapse past the finish line. Body broken. Spirit soaring.

Deej limps over—he hiked the whole course to be at the summit—and for once, his manic energy has been replaced by something genuine. Respect.

"You did it," he says quietly. Then louder: "YOU DID IT!"

He pulls you to your feet and raises your arm like a boxing referee.

"LADIES AND GENTLEMEN, YOUR CHALLENGE 2 SURVIVE CHAMPION!"

The cheers echo off the mountain. Your fellow finalists cross behind you—second, third—and despite everything, they embrace you. This game breaks people, but in the end, you all survived together.

Deej hands you the trophy—a twisted metal sculpture that looks like something between a crown and wreckage.

"I designed this myself," he says. "It's made from parts of my old skateboard. The one I crashed on. Because here's the thing—" He taps your chest. "Champions aren't made from winning. They're made from surviving the crash and getting back up."

He turns to the camera.

"Pain is temporary. Regret is forever. This person? They got NO regrets."

The sun sets over the Croatian mountains. Your journey is complete.

[THE END - CHAMPION ENDING]

ending_runner_up.text:
[ENDING - RUNNER-UP]

Second place.

You cross the finish line moments after the winner. So close you could taste victory. But not quite.

The winner is being swarmed by cameras. The spotlight is on them. You stand just outside it, catching your breath, processing what just happened.

Deej finds you, still catching his own breath from hiking the course.

"Second place in The Finals," he says. "You know what that means? It means you ran MY course and almost won. Do you know how many people can say that? Like, twelve. Total. Ever."

He puts a hand on your shoulder.

"I crashed at the X Games in 2015. Lost everything. Came in LAST. And you know what happened? I came back. 'Almost' isn't the end, dude. 'Almost' is the BEGINNING."

You watch the champion celebrate. It stings. But Deej is right.

The sun sets over the Croatian mountains as you make peace with second place.

There's always next season.

[THE END - RUNNER-UP ENDING]

ending_eliminated.text:
[ENDING - ELIMINATED]

Your torch is snuffed. Your game is over.

You stand in the elimination arena, processing what just happened. You lost. You're going home.

The walk to the exit van is the longest of your life. Behind you, the remaining players watch—some sympathetic, some relieved, some already calculating.

Deej catches you before you get in the van. No cameras. Just him.

"Hey. Look at me."

You look.

"I designed that elimination myself. You know why it was so hard? Because I only design things that TEST people. And you were TESTED. You just didn't win THIS time."

He taps his own knee.

"I got told I'd never walk again. I'm standing here talking to you. Losing isn't the end. Giving up is the end. You gave everything in there. That means something."

In the van, reality sets in. But so does something else: determination.

You learned things in that house. About the game. About others. About yourself.

Next time—if there's a next time—you'll be ready.

[THE END - ELIMINATION ENDING]
